full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 645 Filed 03/11/22 Page 41 of 50 41 M38YMAX2

1 Q. And when I asked you questions, those one-on-one questions, did you pay attention to the instructions at that time?
2 A. Yes, your Honor.
3 Q. Did you listen carefully to my questions?
4 A. Yes, your Honor.
5 Q. Do you have any doubt that you answered those questions accurately?
6 A. I answered every single one of those questions accurately.
7 Q. Might you have failed to pay attention to the specifics of the questions in any way?
8 A. Not at all, your Honor.
9 Q. And how do you know that, given how you approached the questionnaire?
10 A. Because it was a different situation. I wasn't distracted. There weren't things going on. I wasn't sitting there for hours. It was multiple weeks later. So, again, I wasn't -- at that point, I wasn't thinking about my ex.
11 Q. Would you say that you're distracted easily?
12 A. I think I can become distracted, but it had no effect me serving in the jury, on the jury, and listening to all the evidence given during the trial.
13 Q. And what was your approach to my instructions at various points?
14 A. It was to follow them.
15 Q. When you were testifying earlier -- and I asked you some

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
